fields.description:
If I move an issue from one project to another, the summary pane 'By Assignee' at 
/jira/secure/BrowseProject.jspa
does not get updated, and the issue count for the developer stays the same.
Clicking on the name shows the updated number of tickets, and searching on the target project shows the ticket has moved OK.

I tried clearing browser and Jira cache, as well as restarting Jira.
fields.summary: Moving issue does not update display everywhere

fields.description:
Upon installation of Jira 2 the following exception occurs on startup:

2003-03-16 18:46:06,543 ERROR [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] SQL Exception while executing the following:
CREATE TABLE portletconfiguration (ID NUMERIC(18,0) NOT NULL, PORTALPAGE NUMERIC(18,0), PORTLET_ID VARCHAR(255), COLUMN_NUMBER NUMERIC(9,0), POSITION NUMERIC(9,0), CONSTRAINT PK_portletconfiguration PRIMARY KEY (ID))
Error was: java.sql.SQLException: ERROR:  parser: parse error at or near "POSITION"

It seems POSITION is a reserved word in Postgres 7.1.3. I tried this:

> CREATE TABLE TEST (hello VARCHAR(10))
OK

> CREATE TABLE TEST2 (position VARCHAR(10))
ERROR:  parser: parse error at or near "position"

I am using field-type-name="postgres" in entityengine.xml (not "postgres72" as this fails with unknown type: TIMESTAMPTZ)
fields.summary: EntityEngine cannot create POSITION column on postgres 7.1.3

fields.description:
when initializing a new Listener, it'd be good to be able to indicate that something is wrong, rather than waiting until the listener is invoked.

I could (and am) just log something in init when it fails, but the listener will still be called because JIRA doesn't know that it's broken.  if init could throw an exception then it could be disabled.
fields.summary: JiraListener.init should be able to throw exceptions

fields.description:
The readme.txt in the EAR/WAR distribution contains the following few lines:
- copy it to the same location under /edit-webapp
(i.e. if it was /webapp/WEB-INF/classes/osuser.xml, copy it to
/edit-webapp/WEB-INF/classes/osuser.xml)
- edit the file
- rebuild the WAR using 'ant war'

When you update JIRA, the expanded ZIP file will overwrite /webapp
but your changes in /edit-webapp will be maintained.

The above is incorrect.  If you look at the build.xml file, the files are not copied from "edit-webapp" directory but instead are copied from the "edit" directory.
fields.summary: readme.txt is incorrect
POP Service should have the option to use a JNDI session

fields.description:
It would be useful from a management and planing point of view to be able to attach release dates to versions. 
This could be intergrated with the 'estimated time' and 'time spent' of all issues with 'fix for' that release, and (say) 8 developer/hours a day to give an indication of weather the release date was likly to be met or not.
fields.summary: Release dates on versions

fields.description:
There are some issues with paging on the UserBrowser.

If you have over, say, 10 users in the user browser, and you are viewing the "Any" group.  Then click "Next" page.  Viewing users 11 through 20. Then change the group filter to a group that has UNDER 10 users.  You'll end up at a page that says something similar to "Displaying users 11 to of 1. (Reset Filter)" and the users will be shown.

I've also managed to get it to display a page that says "Displaying 21 users to of 0", and no users are shown up on the page at all.

Just some validating when it receives the page number, I think.
fields.summary: UserBrowser paging bug

fields.description:
It seems that Jira uses the colour dark blue "#003366" everywhere to colour text. You can change this fairly trivially by doing a search/relplace over the templates, however this is a little messy (and potentially dangerous).

It would be cool to be able to set the value of that colour as well. For example, our corporate colour is orange, so I want to be able to set that dark blue to dark orange, or "#663300".

fields.description:
We have the XDoclet JIRA set up to automatically pick up issue numbers in the CVS commit mails that get sent out, and add the CVS log message as comments to the issue. (Don't ask me how, Aslak set it up.)

Unfortunately, only the file modifications are being picked up.  I added a bunch of new files to CVS a couple of nights ago, and nothing appeared in the issue.  Also, Aslak tried a few tests on issue XDT-55 and only the modified file showed up in the comments.  "looks like JIRA doesn't know how to pick up "new file" messages. A JIRA bug I'd say." he said.  So I'm reporting it...
fields.summary: CVS syncmail commit messages not picked up

fields.description:
As I mentioned in JRA-1424, I'd had a mail from a user who was having trouble creating an account in the XDoclet JIRA.  Somehow he ended up with an account in the opensymphony JIRA instead of ours.  Now I had thought he'd just ended up on the wrong site and set up the account in theirs by mistake.  However, I've had another mail from him which suggests otherwise:

"That is the strange part: I am sure I started out from the XDoclet part of the site, but remember ending up on the OpenSymphony part. At that time I thought it was maybe a little bit understandeable since Atlassian hosts both sites. However, when I noticed that it didn't work, I followed the 'forgot password' procedure on the XDoclet site and got an e-mail from OpenSymphony with a reset password for... the OpenSymphony site."

Hopefully I've managed to get him set up with an account now, via the user admin pages.  I figured I'd better raise an issue for it, though, in case there's a chance something screwy is going on that you need to investigate.
fields.summary: Problems for user creating account on XDoclet JIRA
Provide a new seperate global level permission for Create New Project

fields.description:
When creating a new filter, then adding a portal for that saved filter, the list of filters to choose from doesn't update correctly.

Steps to recreate.
1) Add a new saved filter
2) Goto dashboard configuration and choose "Add -> Saved Filter"
3) The drop down list of filters doesn't include the new filter.

In addition deleted filters still appear after being deleted.

Current workaround - If I restart the web app (i.e. by touching the web.xml file) the correct list of filters appears.  This leads me to believe it's a caching issue of some kind.
fields.summary: Saved filters don't update correctly on Dashboard Configuration

fields.description:
Not exactly a bug, more a query/request, but there isn't an issue type for that.

Would I be right in thinking that http://jira.opensymphony.com/ actually redirects/forwards to http://opensource.atlassian.com/ ?

I've just had a mail from a user having trouble creating an account in the XDoclet JIRA at http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/xdoclet/, and when he requested a password reminder it came from opensymphony instead.  My suspicion is he's not entered the full URL, and with the opensymphony JIRA being on the root context path he's in fact created the account in that system, not ours, without realising it...

I appreciate it's not a trivial matter, but would it be possible to move the opensymphony one into a separate context root (e.g. /projects/opensymphony) and put a static page in the root path directing people to the appropriate one?  I realise it'll need some coordination to synchronize with changing the URL redirection, but IMO it'll mean less confusion in the long term.

fields.description:
In the XDoclet JIRA (1.4.2#22) I was trying to download the attachments from one of the issues, XDT-132 http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/xdoclet/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=XDT-132

When I select either of the attachments' Download links, http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/xdoclet/secure/attachment/10060/resin-ejb.xdt or http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/xdoclet/secure/attachment/10062/resin-ejb.xdt
I just get the message:

Fatal error in file:/opt/j2ee/atlassian/jira/jira-xdoclet/xdoclet-jira-web/secure/attachment at line 1: Illegal character "<" in encoding name.

I suspect this is because JIRA identifies the Mime Type as text/xml (at least, that's what's displayed on the attachments page).  However, the file in question is actually an XDoclet template file which generates an XML document, and thus begins

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="<XDtConfig:configParameterValue paramName='Xmlencoding'/>"?>

However, it's not a valid XML document itself, just a text file.  Unfortunately, due to the above error I can't download the updated template, which is preventing me from resolving the issue :-(

fields.description:
Can project permissions overwrite global permissions, rather than the other way around as it currently is?

We currently have 18 projects, with a user base of about 40, and roughly 5-6 groups with different responsibilities.  Almost all of the projects function fine using global permissions.  However, we have a need for a small number of projects (2-3) to have their own permissions.  The problem with the current permission system is that if I want those projects to have specific permissions, I now have to manually insert the exact same permissions into the other 16 projects.  You can imagine the problems as the project list grows.  So we've been telling our project managers to please "deal" with the permissions as is, and essentially not using the project permission feature at all.

Any thoughts on how to rework this?  For an internal JIRA installation like ours, overriding global permissions for a project isn't a backdoor, or a workaround for security, so that isn't an issue.  I would prefer that project permissions overrode the global settings, or at least some of them.  Use the global as a default.  Or even that an administrator, not just a project administrator, could allow this?  It's becoming a sticking point amongst our proj mgrs.
fields.summary: Allow Project permissions to override Global Permissions

fields.description:
This proposal applies to everyone who has a large amount of projects.
How to easy it is to find the project one is looking for? The current list is too large.

Although the new portal stuff could help a bit here, I am not so fond of it. A (new) user should not need to go through a learning curve of adapting portals before he can easily find that specific project.

Therefore I would like to make it much easier for users to find the project they are looking for. See below.

--
Proposed solution:

Add an extra metadata field to a project describing its category. This is a free text field that can be entered or modified by an administrator at all times. 

With this extra category field it is reasonably straight forward to show on the Jira homepage a dropdown box with all categories. This owuld allow the user to select one categroy from the dropdownbox to filter the total list of projects and show only the shortened list.

(One can make it more generic even by defining filters for projects like you do now for issues..)

Each Jira installation can completely define which and how many categories are used.

You could use breadcrumbs to show actually the path one has choosen to view this project. This will make navigation much easier.

--
Example:

Our category field would for example have the following categories: products, components, support. Projects of the "products" category are interesting for sales &  product managers. Projects of the "components" category are more interesting for developers. Projects of the "support" category are interesting for support managers.
fields.summary: Allow categorization of projects and use drilldown menu/breadcrumbs for navigating them

fields.description:
When using a bug tracking system inside a company, users end up
submitting all their reports with the highest priority available.
This makes priority ordering unusable.

In most projects, the priority is evaluated at the assignement step,
but this is not applicable when the policy is to let users
evaluate priority.

One way to improve this would be to let users choose the
priority, but enforce a maximum count of open issues in higher
priority level. Users would then have to either reevaluate the
priority of the new entry or close/change the priority of
other open issues.

Such feature would really help keeping a clean/uptodate repository
without limiting access to the bug tracking system.
fields.summary: Add a maximum count of "Blocking" or "Major" issues

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days, including the attachment "screenshot-1.jpg"; however there are no immediate plans to put this suggestion on our near term roadmap.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Daniel Franz
dfranz@atlassian.com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
  

Whilst experimenting with the issue linking functionality, we came up with the idea that as well as just linking, it would be great if we could add a dependancy on another issue.  So we can setup a work-flow that says "before IS-334 can be done, IS-331 and IS-332 must be compleated."

Allow filter by "Next Unreleased Version"
the Resolved recently filter is incorrect, it is filtering for "reopend" and "close", think it should be "resolved" and "closed" instead

fields.description:
I wanted deleted a component in my project.  I clicked delete, and I get the confirm page with the familiar "Cannot set focus" JavaScript error popup.  The page noted "Deleting this component will not alter any issues, as there are 0 issues associated with this issue".

Perhaps the page assumes there will be at least one?
fields.summary: Deleting component with no issues

fields.description:
I wanted to merge two versions into one.  I chose "Alpha" and "1.0" in my from, and applied it to "Alpha" in the to.

Two problems with this:
1) When I click merge, I get the confirm page with a "Cannot move focus to control" JavaScript popup error.
2) When I confirm, I get:
HTTP Status 500 - Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.version.VersionDelete@70bca1, result: error You cannot swap the affects version to the version you are deleting. You cannot swap the fix for version to the version you are deleting.

Fine, but that's what I'd like to do.  I understand I can just delete 1.0, and move them all to Alpha, but it seems easier to do through the merge page.

If you won't allow me to do this, perhaps a nice error message (that is trapped :) ), that suggests that I just delete one ver to move the issues over?
fields.summary: Merging two versions into one
